title: A Courageous New Year
sub_title: Finding Courage in the Face of Fear
devotional:
Eliza loved the New Year. It wasn't so much about the parties or the resolutions, but the sense of a clean slate. But this year, a shadow hung over even the twinkling lights and festive music. Her bakery, a lifelong dream, was on the verge of closing. The competition had grown fierce, and despite her best efforts, she was struggling to keep up. Fear gnawed at her, whispering doubts about her abilities and the wisdom of pursuing such a risky venture. Every unsold loaf felt like a personal failure, every bill a crushing weight.

On the last day of the year, she stood amidst the scent of vanilla and cinnamon, but the joy had evaporated. As the clock ticked closer to midnight, she found herself staring out the window, watching the city prepare to celebrate. A wave of despair washed over her. Maybe it was time to admit defeat, to close the doors and find something "safer." But then, she remembered her grandmother's words: "Courage isn't the absence of fear, Eliza, it's facing fear head-on, knowing you're not alone."

Eliza closed her eyes and whispered a prayer, asking for strength and guidance. She didn't know what the new year held, but she knew she couldn't give up without a fight. She decided to experiment with a new pastry inspired by her grandmother's secret recipe. With renewed determination, she mixed, kneaded, and baked, pouring her heart into each step. The aroma filled the bakery, a sweet promise of hope.

As midnight arrived, Eliza didn't pop champagne or watch fireworks. She was still baking. But this time, it wasn't out of obligation, but out of a newfound sense of purpose. The first batch of her grandmother's pastries sold out almost immediately. New customers were drawn in by the irresistible aroma and the comforting warmth of her bakery. It wasn't an instant miracle, but it was a start – a small victory fueled by courage, faith, and a grandmother's wisdom.
image_description: A bakery storefront with glowing lights and a window display of festive holiday pastries, decorated with New Years garland.
insights: Eliza's story mirrors the biblical narrative of numerous figures who faced seemingly insurmountable challenges. Joshua's call to leadership in Joshua 1:9 reminds us, 'Have I not commanded you? Be strong and courageous. Do not be frightened, and do not be dismayed, for the Lord your God is with you wherever you go.' This verse emphasizes that courage is not merely an innate trait, but a divine mandate, rooted in the assurance of God's constant presence. Similarly, David's courage in facing Goliath (1 Samuel 17) stemmed from his faith in God's power, not his own abilities.
prayer: Heavenly Father, I confess that I often feel overwhelmed by fear and doubt. When challenges arise, it's easy to lose sight of Your presence and purpose. I ask for Your strength and courage to face the unknown with faith and determination. Help me to remember that You are always with me, guiding and supporting me through every trial. Fill me with Your peace and hope, and empower me to step out in courage, trusting in Your unwavering love. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: Where in your life are you currently facing fear or uncertainty? What is one small step you can take today, fueled by faith and courage, to overcome that challenge? How can you actively remind yourself of God's constant presence and unwavering support?
